text:
```julia> module A
       using LinearAlgebra
       ldiv!(x) = 2
       end```
redefines a new ldiv! and doesn't error or warn, although it does error at the REPL. Shouldn't it? Sorry if this is a dumb question, I didn't find any discussion of it

text: So I don't know about the appropriate messaging, but that would mean that packages can't have redefinitions of existing functions that have nothing to do with the environment they inherit, but have to contend with extending the package, which could potentially have an effect on other functions' behavior. text: <@UMDEUKM29> did you use the `LinearAlgebra.ldiv!` function in the REPL? If you use it in your module A, unqualified, before defining that function, then I expect you get the same error. If you start a new REPL and paste in the contents of module A, I expect you get no error.
<@UC4QQPG4A> can't the same argument be made at the REPL?

text:
No, it does not error in the REPL. Only if you have used `ldiv!` before:
```julia> using LinearAlgebra

julia> ldiv!(x) = x
ldiv! (generic function with 1 method)```
But
```julia> using LinearAlgebra

julia> ldiv!(1.0, [1.0;]);

julia> ldiv!(x) =2
ERROR: error in method definition: function LinearAlgebra.ldiv! must be explicitly imported to be extended```

elements.text: No, it does not error in the REPL. Only if you have used

julia> using LinearAlgebra

julia> ldiv!(x) = x
ldiv! (generic function with 1 method)

julia> using LinearAlgebra

julia> ldiv!(1.0, [1.0;]);

julia> ldiv!(x) =2
ERROR: error in method definition: function LinearAlgebra.ldiv! must be explicitly imported to be extended

text:
This creates an error in a fresh REPL:
```julia> module A
           using LinearAlgebra
           ldiv!
           ldiv!(x) = 2
       end
ERROR: error in method definition: function LinearAlgebra.ldiv! must be explicitly imported to be extended
Stacktrace:
 [1] top-level scope at none:0
 [2] top-level scope at REPL[1]:4```

           using LinearAlgebra
           ldiv!
           ldiv!(x) = 2
       end
ERROR: error in method definition: function LinearAlgebra.ldiv! must be explicitly imported to be extended
Stacktrace:
 [1] top-level scope at none:0
 [2] top-level scope at REPL[1]:4
